H0.text: Irreversible enzyme inhibitors are toxins and poisons.

H1.text: Reversible toxins and poisons are enzyme inhibitors.

H2.text: Cancerous is the adjective describing toxins and poisons that are enzyme inhibitos.

H3.text: Observable are toxins and poisons that inhibit enzymes.

A4.text: Since ricin is a catalytic irreversible inhibitor, this allows just a single molecule of ricin to kill a cell.

A5.text: Other artificial enzyme inhibitors block acetylcholinesterase, an enzyme which breaks down acetylcholine, and are used as nerve agents in chemical warfare.

A6.text: An example of a neurotoxin are the glycoalkaloids, from the plant species in the family Solanaceae (includes potato, tomato and eggplant), that are acetylcholinesterase inhibitors.

A7.text: Natural poisons are usually small organic molecules and are so diverse that there are probably natural inhibitors for most metabolic processes.
